text: I have been here a few times already and the sandwiches are great they are big enough to split between two people if you're just wanting to snack on something. This is definitely a place I would go back too.

After traveling to Las Vegas I was looking for a quick bite to eat. There was a special posted for 1/2 turkey or ham sandwich with your choice of chicken noodle soup, ceasar salad or mushroom soup for $7.99. I opted for the 1/2 turkey sandwich with chicken noodle soup. This was very tasty and the server Erendira was great.
New Yorker was delicious and had just the right amount of cheese. Chicken pesto sandwich with mozzarella was ok. Cheesecake was great too. Good coffee and friendly service.

I usually walk over from Mandalay bay for breakfast.
Good food, reasonable prices.
Staff is friendly.
I usually get the egg and bacon bagel.

Hmm! Can this even be a real NY-style Jewish deli without any matzo ball soup? These are life's complicated questions. Anyway, I have not had any of their deli sandwiches yet, just their jumbo hot dog, which was just okay.
Simply a very good place to get good food on the spot! Open 24hrs and $10 bucks a plate!

Great sandwiches that didn't disappoint. I had the chicken pesto with roasted red pepper. My fianc√© had The Boss and she loved it. I would highly recommend this place as a quick bite if you are in the Luxor hotel. Prices were even decent!

I had the turkey blt.  It's their #2 triple decker.  Great sandwich, but it was $15
You could split it between two people as it's pretty big

Always a line! We wanted a late night snack after leaving RT 91 Harvest Festival. Got there around 1130 and waited 25 mins to order but once placed, order filled timely. The cooks were personable and prices reasonable.  Try the California wrap, good portion of turkey. Glad it's close to our room!
29 minutes to serve a burger.  Other reviewer is correct.  Undermanned or badly managed

This review is based on our recent breakfast experience. The food was not very good at all. Subpar fast food quality at 3 times the price. Breakfast for 2 cost $35, and fountain drinks were $4 each. Would not recommend earing there for breakfast.

The Chicken Noodle Soup is good by any standard. However, If this was a restaurant located any place other than Las Vegas, and any place other than inside a hotel casino, it would not get 5 stars; that's pretty generous. But, it is located in a Vegas hotel casino and for the standard, it is EXCELLENT. It's convenient, open 24 hours, the food is pretty darn good with some HEALTHY options, and the PRICES ARE REASONABLE. I was very pleasantly surprised by that when I needed some soup for my cold. I'd actually seek this place out next time I'm in Vegas. The only other food here is pricey or disgusting/fatty.
Food not that good, fair price though. I ordered a chocolate and is way too sweet! You can't even take 2 or three bites because you will get sugar rush.

The food here is great and it's open 24/7! My favorite item is the breakfast sandwich, it's delicious. My bf had the triple decker and it was very satisfying, piled high. I love that they serve breakfast all day. This place is perfect for after a night of drinking.

went here the first night we got into vegas.  we were staying at the luxor and had been drinking since we got in at 11:30am with nothing to eat. so around 9:30pm we decided it might be a good idea to get some food and then wander the strip after we took a little nap.  we got down there, and my friend was so drunk he could barely order (but it was his 21st birthday, so it is a given he would be hammered), but the staff was really patient with him and didn't get frustrated.  there was a mix up with the guys making the sandwiches and they ended up making an extra BLT which they just gave us for free since they said they would have to throw it out otherwise.  the sandwiches were pretty damn tall, tasted great, and hit the spot.  the BLT was really good, crispy bacon, fresh lettuce and tomato, good sourdough bread.  i got the corned beef and pastrami and swiss triple decker and it was huge and delicious.  as far as sandwiches, it was a good choice and i wouldn't mind going back
...if you love freshly brewed reasonably-priced coffee... this is your place... and definitely try a danish and a breakfast bagel sandwich with bacon... delicious!!

The food here is delicious, and prepared to order a.k.a. FRESH! For Strip prices it very reasonable. I did not order a drink and the total was about $15 for a big Reuben sandwhich and a decent size basket of onion rings. I would highly recommend enjoying a bite here.
I love the fact that they offered turkey sausage. Most place don't offer a turkey product for breakfast. The food was tasty. I am eating here tomorrow.

We ate here for breakfast and every meal was absokutely nasty. Our pancakes were inconsistant and tasted like cardboard. Some were burned. The sausage tasted like it had expired and was rubbery. I would avoid this place at all costs unless you are looking for a bottle of water late at night.
Terrible breakfast. Don't, bother. I had a crappy bagel sandwich.  I should have hit McDonalds.

Great place. Open 24 hours. Food is okay but yo come here cause it's open. I always get the breakfast and haven't had anything else.  

The line is kinda long but it moves fast. There's plenty of room to sit and eat your food.

Worst meal I have ever eaten in Las Vegas. Actually worst meal I am ever eaten in all of the USA. I had the Hash & Eggs and was warned by the guy taking my order to not get my eggs pouched, as they "don't do them very well here". That should have been my sign to walk away. I got the scrambled eggs instead which I wouldn't say were good but were edible at least, unlike the corn beef hash which I took one bite of and then one more to give them the benefit of the doubt. I regretted that second bite. The hash brown cake was fine but nothing special. I am actually pretty easy to please when it comes to food, but this just made me so sad. My husband said my face, when I took one look and my first bite of my meal, looked like I had died on the inside. Seriously, don't eat here.

Went there on Sunday, food great but had to wait quite a while for it and had no trouble getting a cup of water with the order. Went there two days later and they tried to charge us 65 cents a cup for tap water. After arguing that we got it free two days ago the register person got on the phone with the manager and they finally gave us the water for free. But what a hassle just for water with my food. Love the food but be careful what the may charge you for and don't be in a hurry to get it.
A great sandwich shop open 24 hours a day. When staying at the hotel I will eat here multiple times on the trip. Can't go wrong with their triple decker ruben!

Great place for quick service sandwiches.  You can charge meals to your room.  We had the Turkey BLT and All American hot dog with waffle fries.  Everything was delicious and came with large portions.

I take back my old post, yeah it's a little expensive but it's a lot of food. My wife got a combo with her order and I just got the cheese steak and we were to full to finish our food. Worth the money

After the semi-drama my friends and I ran into at Tryst, we all head back to Luxor (where we were staying) to grab some late night grub. The cheeseburger here is a MUST try. I don't know what kind of bun they use for it, but it's so good. The fries are awesome too. The only thing I regret is not being able to finish my order.

Walked by late one night at the Luxor and was hit by an incredible smell. Immediately walked up to the counter and asked what that smell was. The New Yorker...Corned Beef w/ thousand island dressing on a pretzel bun!!! AMAZING, I ordered it with sweet potato fried and was in heaven! Couple packets of yellow mustard and a soda and I was making a mess of my self. My friend ordered a Cobb salad and it was equally impressive. The one drawback here is that it doesnt have enough seating. So take it to go, or stare at someone until you make everyone uncomfortable.

We love this little deli tucked into a corner of the Luxor! Perfect for a small breakfast before a day of Vegas fun. There are a lot of choices here and although we only had breakfast here, we will try lunch next time as their sandwich choices looked great as well. The service is fast and friendly. We tipped the cashier and he thanked us nicely. One morning we were there pretty early and it was fun watching people dressed in their clubwear strolling in on the way to the elevators as we were just starting our day. Went there twice during our week long stay at the Luxor! We'll be back!

Prices are roughly $9.99 for each sandwich / wrap and add on fries or salad for $3 which is moderate considering Vegas prices. The sandwiches are made to order - and they're OK -- nothing special and nothing terrible. 

The side asian salad was pretty good flavor-wise but definitely over-dressed. Overall a solid choice if you're tired of fried food and want something SEMI-healthy.

I was pleasantly surprised that a deli inside a hotel could produce a decent sandwich. I got the $10 pesto chicken, and the sandwich fed me to satisfaction both in taste and portion. Although I prefer to try out the "local" spots (and preferably new places if my stops weren't amazing) rather than places in hotels, I would dare so I would not object to going back here if the situation called for it. 

Bottom line: Don't scoff too hard, as quality is higher than you'd think.
Not only was the burger I had bad, it was also cold. All I wanted was a decent bacon cheeseburger. What I got wasn't edible at all; even the bacon was bad! How do you screw up bacon?!

Amazing food and great service. I had the cheese burger and it was amazing. Yes, it was 10 dollars, but the meat was medium rare (at my choice) and it was juicy and sweet. I would come here again, and bring a crowd. And the seats are very comfy

Food was good but way overpriced. They charged me $1 for a cup of water. $6 for a Chicago dog. (Bun very thick on one side) husband got a patty melt, over $10. Gave me a bite. Was very hard and crusty. He liked it so .... ok. $3 or $4 for potato fries. Needed salt badly. Because of the high prices, would not go again

Cheeseburger, fries and a Pepsi. Hit the gapping hole that was in my stomach. The cheeseburger was great with more sale than I would have expected at an American burger joint. Fries were just the right amount of soft on the inside but crunchy on the outside.

Grabbed a quick bite here before we checked out of the Luxor (had to use our food credit on SOMETHING!)

I got the bagel and lox plate and my boyfriend for a ham and cheese sandwich.  The lox plate was fantastic with a generous pile of lox, capers, onions, tomatoes, olive and a boiled egg. The ham and cheese sandwich was reported to be ok but nothing special as it was literally ham, cheese, lettuce and tomato on bread with no mustart or mayo.  

A few hours later a friend of ours came by and was hungry so we headed back to the deli so he could eat.  He picked up the Turkey and Pastrami sandwich which was basically as big as my head.

I will definitely hit up Backstage if I am staying at the Luxor again, the prices were right and the food was much better than I expected it to be.

This place has great sandwiches. Open 24/7 so the lines can get rather long. Got the turkey sandwich and it was piled high! Fountain drinks are way over priced at $4. Overall a great place to eat, especially when all the other restaurants are closed.

Their pastrami sandwich on rye with coleslaw and russian dressing reminds me of my favorite sandwich in Los Angeles, but their $4 fountain sodas were a huge turnoff.   The fries weren't great and their hot dogs are just okay.    I only ate here because I arrived on the strip close to midnight after several hours of driving.   If you are staying at Luxor, I recommend that you eat at the food court at Excalibur or that you go across the street to MGM.

This place has decent sandwiches and will provide satisfactory sustenance if you don't want to leave Luxor, but I'd recommend venturing outward.
Great food at any time!!  Breakfast pancakes are delicious.  Turkey club is fabulous.

First plus, this place is open 24/7! We are obviously hungry coming home from clubs around 1-2am, and there aren't many options still open at the hotel at that time. So glad we found this one! The say cheese sandwich is delicious! Also tried the onion rings and they are tasty as well. Sandwiches range from $12-18 roughly. So a little more than, say, a subway sandwich, but not even comparable in quality. Very generous portions, enough for 2. And very well made and flavorful. Recommend for a late night meal or an afternoon lunch.

Delicious food, friendly staff, and they are open late! It is easy to get your food to go, and portions are so large that you'll probably want a to go box anyway. The food is fresh and there is quite a lot of variety on the menu.

There are two things I love that I don't have that often. Pretzel bread and rueben sandwiches. When I saw this place had both, I had to go. The first time I went, I ordered the #5 (Rueben on Pretzel Bread) and it was about $10. I loved it so much that I went back a couple days later for another one! This time I ordered waffle fries too since I was really hungry. I also ordered two sides of thousand island this time because one wasn't enough last time. I like to dip my sandwiches in sauce when I have it, so I use a lot of it. The waffle fries weren't anything special, so I probably wouldn't get them again.

Backstage Deli is located in the back of the casino, next to the Cris Angel theatre. After you order, you're given a buzzer that does off when your order is ready. At that time, you toss the buzzer in a basket at the end of the counter and grab your food. Both times, the man that handed me my food was very nice. They have a decent size sitting area with tables and the restaurant is completely open. (overlooking casino)

I don't think the price is that high for being in a casino and the quality is very good, so I think the sandwich is worth $10. I noticed that they have another Rueben on the menu that is bigger I think. I don't think it comes on pretzel bread though because it wasn't listed, like it is on the #5. If you love pretzel bread like me, make sure you order the right one!

Tip: Use your Mlife card to get points here.

If you are looking for an OK sandwich with a OK price then this is it. I tried reuben sandwich and also burger. I don't recommend the burger as it is like those frozen burgers you buy at grocery store. Reuben tastes good.

We used the last of our dining comps for lunch prior to check out. We all ordered a variety of items and were pleasantly surprised and relatively pleased with our meals. The fries were super tasty and I can always appreciate a dill pickle with my order.

Note: The breakfast steak sandwich is pretty big and large enough for two. The patty melt was nicely toasted but really greasy. Overall, decent meal at the Luxor.

The Chicken Caesar sandwich was fantastic! I loved the ciabatta bread, while the chicken was thick and tender (almost too tender). The only change I would have made was swapping out the lettuce so it was all romaine, not romaine and iceberg mixed together.

I wasn't impressed with Erendira, the woman who took my order, but the chef and the young lady tidying up the joint were both super nice. Open 24 hours and serving breakfast all day, it's a great choice if you're staying at Luxor or Excalibur.

Docked one point for: The less-than-welcoming demeanor of Erendira and that my fountain soda was $4. I could have snagged one from the vending machine for less.
I ordered a vegetable sandwich and it was delicious. Considering how busy this place is I got my food fairly quick.

Delicious sandwich! Made to order, nice and hot. I opted for the turkey on cheddar bread. It was delicious and had big chunks of avocado. They messed up my request for no tomatoes, but made me a replacement without any fuss. At $10.99 it was a bit expensive, but it's Vegas so not too bad considering. It was a good sized sandwich too. 

I will definitely be back.

I came here on a Friday night because I was tired and wanted something quick/cheap in the hotel that was not food court fare. This place is open 24/7, which is awesome because the food is great. I got the Omaha (corned beef, sauerkraut, Swiss cheese and thousand island on toasted and buttered rye bread). It was delicious, and so was the pickle that came with it. They also have a case of desserts and several different treats of the month. I picked up their cookie of the month, which was a massive brookie and it was probably one of the best I've ever had. I paid $17 for these two items, which is a little on the expensive side for not having a side/drink, but it's Vegas so I can't say I'm surprised. It's great food 24 hours a day in the convenience of your hotel, what more could you ask for?

The Backstage Deli is located in The Luxor close to Elevator 2. It's convenient but doesn't stay open 24 hours. I had a Cajun Dog and my BF had a Chinese Chicken Salad. His salad was not bad at all. My dog though was just OK. It had a gross sweet "Cajun" sauce on it. The dog itself was OK. The place is pretty clean but service is kind of slow. There are booths and tables. I would only come here if I needed a quick small bite. There's so much good food in Las Vegas that I would not come here otherwise.

Hidden gem, this place is! I discovered this place on a recent stay at the Luxor Hotel and was very impressed. It is in the very back of the Luxor Casino Floor right near the #2 Elevators.

A great thing about this place is it is open 24 hours and all menu items are served 24 hours. So whether it is early morning, dinner time, or 3 AM after a long night of drinking, you can come here and order a burger, sandwich, breakfast, salads, hotdogs and more.

The #11 Pollo Panini is a good option. It comes with grilled chicken breast, mozzarella, roasted peppers, tomato and chipotle mayo on a decent roll. The chipotle mayo has a nice little kick to it. 

We also got the #3 Triple Decker (turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, mayo). This thing is HUGE! They do not skimp on the portions. You know how when you walk into a fast food joint and see the plump juicy burger pictured on the wall with crisp lettuce and thick tomato slices but then when you get it, it looks like a flimsy thin piece of cardboard? That is not the case here. The sandwich is just how it looks. Huge!

They also have a lot of small dessert options that aren't shown on the menu. Cookies, brownies, strawberry shortcake, cheesecake, chocolate mousse. We got the Chocolate Mousse and the Fruit Custard and were pleased with both!

Open 24 hours, good food, good portions, healthy options, dessert options. What more could you want??

OMFG my bf and I agree that this place cooks the BEST cheeseburger!!!! It was a bit pricey ($8), but well worth it. They asked how we wanted our meat! I have never ordered a cheeseburger where someone asked me how I want my meat cooked! I wanna go to Vegas just for the cheeseburger right now....P.S. don't be tempted to buy tickets for this Cirque show w/ Criss Angel that's located right next to this deli. You will want your money back.

We've visited this place twice now and both times were delicious! You have to try the corned beef and pastrami sandwich it's so good! The sandwiches are decent sized you could definitely split one and add a side and you would be set for two people. The only down side is that it can get expensive it was 4 dollars for one regular sized fountain drink. That was a little ridiculous. But the food is good will definitely be back!

Great Sandwiches ...

I tried New Yorker / Reuben / Burgers ( ALL DELISH )

Located in the corner of the Luxor Casino & Hotel ... Only bad thing about this place is the $5.00 small fountain drink ... That's way over priced !!

Open 24 hours.. 

Turkey swiss wrap = good. Made to order.   

French fries = thick cut but they were crispy! 

Cobb salad = perfect, except that it was missing the stated bacon.  lol  

Service = friendly. 

Prices = moderate.  It's a 24-hour joint at the Luxor.  Room service costs more than this place.

For $36 dollars in a casino for two sandwiches, 2sets of fries, and 2 drinks on the strip it wasn't bad.  It came out on plastic plates but the portions were good, and the meat was 'meat' not that plastic like substance at most joints.  It does not compare to a real NY deli but the Rueben and New Yorker hit the spot.

If you come here expecting the 2nd coming of a NY sandwich, go put your life savings on the roulette table first.  

Strip Casino joints are all over priced but this joint was tasty.  I would be back again especially since it is open 24 hours a day.  The waffle fries are pretty damn good.
Not only is this place open 24/7 but the sandwiches there are amazingly good!!! The fries are thick and fresh!!! I love love this place. My go to place for lunch when I'm in Vegas:)
I've been here several times for a quick bite. Love the chicken caesar wrap with fries and a soda. Decent price (for the Strip), quick in and out, 24 hours and friendly service.

Here's the dilemma: either you're short on time, by yourself, inebriated, or some combination of all three. You want something to eat. The 24 hour diner has a line, plus you'll need to deal with a waitress and a wait. Options are limited.

But you're in Vegas! Who wants to waste stomach space at the food court? You can eat that chain stuff whenever you want at home. This is where the Backstage Deli has tons of value. Solid deli sandwiches, not much of a line, and you'll get your food in ten minutes or so. Then, go hang out at the sports book and watch some sports while you get your nosh on. You've successfully avoided eating McDonald's in Vegas, and have some free entertainment while you eat too!

6/28: Located in Luxor. My second visit. I was walking around Luxor/The Shoppes at Mandalay Bay and stopped by here to eat. Decided to use all of my poker comps during my first visit (11/26). Wasn't expecting anything special, just standard cafe food, but I was wrong. I ordered a Cheeseburger with Swiss Cheese. It ended up to be one of the best burgers I've ever had! Especially the bun. I'm not sure what type it is (not a normal sesame bun), though it was very soft and fresh. The fries were great as well. 

I got the Turkey Burger this time around. Same awesome taste and quality. 

Both burgers were somewhat plain, nothing fancy, but great. The grease was minimal, focusing more on other aspects of the burger. Very clean meal and didn't feel sick or stuffed afterwards. The chefs were friendly as well, and I could tell they put actual effort into their craft, even though they're in a "normal" deli/cafe. 

The Strawberry Cheesecake and Chocolate Covered Strawberries were good as well. I'll definitely be back!

Had the All American Breakfast (2 eggs & choice of meat and hash-brown patty).
Service was fast reasonably friendly and food was good, coffee was standard dinner fair. There are 2 Starbucks in Luxor should you require higher quality or more choices on your caffeine.

So when you find yourself starving at 2 am and absolutely nothing is open fear not there is the Backstage Deli - you just have to find it.  I'm still in complete awe that there wasn't a coffee shop to be found open at that hour.  How is that even possible?  But thank pancakes for Backstage and their pancakes!  They were fluffy and buttery and delicious and most importantly despite the seriously long line it was probably 20 minutes elapsed time from line to fork in mouth.  
Prices were reasonable and the food was good.  I really expected it to be total crap because they could get away with it but it's not! I might even go back when it's not 2am.

The only place to grab a quick bite to eat.  The hotel has no after hours room service, so this is the only 24 hour offering.  

Small menu, burgers, sandwiches. They do breakfast all day.  Foods good, plenty of seating;,service is rapid. Staff is friendly. Recommend for groups or families with kids. Eat up and then start your day.

Came here after a long night and needed a midnight snack. I ordered the philly cheese steak and onion rings. The philly cheese steak was surprisingly good. There was a good portion of steak for the price I paid. The onion rings were way too greasy that I didn't want to eat it. The food came out quickly even though the line was a bit long for 1AM.

Stopped in here to catch a late night snack after checking out the strip. Ordered and got our food within very good timing. My Philly cheesesteak had just the right amount of cheese and was grilled well with the peppers and onions. My bf had himself a juicy burger and definitely was not disappointed. Pricing for the food was decent but almost ten bucks for a Gatorade and water was a little upsetting but oh well, it's Vegas. I really appreciate this deli being 24 hours. Anything 24 hours is a friend of mine.

The food here is surprising good for a place that's open 24/7. 

Almost all of the food is made fresh while you wait. Each time we came here, it was always fast and tasty. The salads are so huge and fresh, they are more of a 2 person serving instead of 1. 

The prices were reasonable as well considering how expensive Vegas has gotten.

All 4 orders plus the Carrot cake were delicious. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly. We ordered the Chicago style Hotdog, ( Realky good and different) Philly Cheesestaeak, The California Burger, Sweet Potatoe Fries, and Onion Rings! Onion Rings were so bomb and fresh!
We would highly recommend this restaurant at anytime of the day! Good thing it's open 24 hrs a day!!!
The Cook Ralphy was awesome polite, and so respectful as our Old School Latinos are. The cashier Judianna has awesome customer service.
We will be back again!!! (Sooner than later! I hope! )

With prices on the room service menu outrageous this was a great place to get a quality sandwich and fries to bring back to the room at the end of the night. As a former sandwich maker I was so impressed to see the attention that the chef's put into each order. They were incrediubly patient and nice. I really felt like it was my order that was the only order they cared about when they put it together. The Backstage Deli is by the Las Vegas book location in the casino and although I did very little gambling I did make a couple of trips to the deli and was so very happy with my food. Make this the place for late night snacks!! Thanks, guys!!!!

The food is good I ate here twice while staying at the Luxor. The prices are incredibly high though.  $4 for a small drink is crazy. I averaged $19 on a meals. I think if the prices were slightly lower this place would be a five star no doubt. If you're looking for a cheap lunch probably not the place to go.

The wait to order was long but once we got our sandwiches, we were lost in them. $23 for a burger and a club with no sides was a bit steep but I got them comped through past play anyways. 
I can recommend the California burger with bacon, avocado, lettuce and tomato. The bacon is really good here and they do not scrimp on it. The club's toast was cold but otherwise a solid sandwich consisting of turkey, bacon, etc. ( no mayo) Fresh.
Wish I had remembered to take a quick photo but we were so hungry, the food was devoured in haste!
Will return for sure.

Two stars because they were open when I needed something to eat, AND didn't get food poisoning afterwards. 

Bottom line: it's an undermanned, greasy diner. There should only be two reason why you'd eat here: 1. Need to use the complimentary food voucher from Luxor or 2. You're a bad gambler and now your kids are hungry. 

Good job mom & dad, maybe next time you'd keep the food budget in a separate sock so you won't put it all-in on J10 off-suit, you idiot. 

PS. There is a 3rd reason to eat there: IF all your friends are watching Criss Angel and you're too broke to afford the tix with no battery left on your phone, with no hotel room key. That way you can keep an eye on the crowd as they exit the show to make sure you don't lose your wolf pack. Makes me wonder what kind of a untrustworthy friend you are to not have a room key...

Terrible reheated frozen miniaturized plastic food!  Order the american breakfast.  Biscuit were the size of a quarter. Sausage was a 1/4 thick. Even the eggs were small.  Most of all it was disgusting.  Tasted straight out of a cardboard box.
Great 24-hour breakfast! Perfect over-easy eggs. Everybody else seems to  have pre-made scrambled eggs only, nice to find a place that makes fresh over easy!

Back in November when we stayed here. We wanted some breakfast one morning so we came here, for quick breakfast. Not to bad it was good basic. We shared the French toast , enough for two people and got two plates of the eggs and bacon. We also got a small cheesecake it was better than the breakfast now time to gamble!

Review here from someone who isn't drunk when ordering from there, just likes to be up late with food options. Many hot food choices. Large amount of sides here, had to alert my BF before ordering about the sweet potato fries. Also soup.
Heavily reminds me of a greasy spoon with the grill aroma.

I was thankful there was the option to eat something before I leave for the airport.

I got the chicken petso sandwich, and my BF went with the Rueben. Sticking with what our stomachs know.

I def. recommend this place to anymore staying nearby. It is fast, fresh,   and affordable. It is very good food. I ended up eating at least 1 meal at day here on my vacation. The sandwiches are huge!!!! You can def. share 1.  Love the waffle fries, onion rings are good too just a bit greasy.!!! They let you add and substitute anything onto your meal!!! This place is a must

The Good: It's right next to the Criss Angel Theater at The Luxor, so it's the best place to grab a bottle of water or quick bite.

The Bad: It's right next to the Criss Angel Theater at The Luxor, so chances are you won't be the only one looking for a bottle of water or a quick bite. Waited a good 20 minutes for one bottle of water!

Avoid coming here at that time, and you'll be all set!

This wasn't our planned post-race eating spot, but things change, and you have to adapt. We chose Backstage because it was within our hotel, we could order food to bring back to our room, and the prices weren't sky-high, like the room service menu items.

They seem to have a lot of very good people working at this restaurant. It was busy that night (it seemed like quite a few runners were taking their post-workout meal there), but the kitchen staff was working quickly, and the girl working the register was super friendly.

I wasn't feeling super hungry, but knew that I needed to at least eat something, so I ordered a fruit plate and a butter croissant. My husband went with the California Burger and an order of fries. We got our number and headed over to a table to wait. Again, the tables that were occupied seemed to be occupied with people who were doing the same thing - everybody looked ready to bolt the second their food came up.

I grabbed a bunch of condiment packets, napkins and plastic utensils before settling down at a table. There were about four people in front of us, so we knew we had a bit of a wait for my husband's burger (my fruit plate and croissant were handed to me when we paid).

I was impressed by the size of the fruit plate. I saw it on the menu, then saw a fruit cup in their refrigerated display case, and was afraid that I was going to end up with that. Instead, I got a huge platter full of red and green grapes, pineapple, honeydew, cantaloupe and watermelon slices, as well as two (TWO!) strawberries. The fruit was fresh and good, and I was surprised by the fact that I couldn't finish it all. The croissant was flaky and buttery, and I had no problem polishing that off.

My husband liked his burger, once he had it assembled. It was a big dang burger, and they didn't seem to skimp on the order of fries, either. They smelled really delicious, but I didn't try any.

Overall, it was nice to have a non-sit-down option within the hotel that didn't cost more than our entire Vegas stay. 

Plus, they get extra points for helpful staff. There was an incident with a runner at the condiment station, and they helped us handle it quickly and safely. I sure hope that guy is okay.

I went looking for something to eat late night after a long flight into Vegas and found this place. The Cobb salad was huge and fresh took most of it to my room and the fries were perfect. my friends fruit cup was not even close to having ripe melon in it and the fruit tart was terrible. My going to other places near the hotel made me realize this is close to high fining in Vegas outside some ridiculously priced places that would not last a week in New York. so I have returned here a few times the cookies are good as are most desserts, I like the staff and dos here my Vegas favorite.
Glad we found this place! inexpensive way for dinner, turkey burger is highly recommended

I can't quite pinpoint what makes this place so appealing. I think they've just got a lot of things right, and it comes together for a great experience. 

Over my Las Vegas stay, I ended up coming back to this deli twice to order the same thing. The No Yolk sandwich was only $12, came with delicious, buttery spinach, tomatoes, and mushrooms, had a generous portion of tater tots, and was ready in under 5 minutes.

The next time I'm in Vegas I'll stop by this place again. Great job, guys!

The Reuben was great! It is a surprisingly great choice for late night snacking.
The service was decent...ish. The place was clean, the prices are high in comparison to the real world but reasonable by casino/Disney/movie theater snack pricing-scale. I was happy overall, and I would go back if I were in that god forsaken casino again.
Good cheap eats! I had the Sonoma style hotdog and it was chock full of toppings. It's like the south strip version of earl of sandwich.

I cannot get enough of this place! We stay at this hotel 3-4 times a month for leisure and actually request to be put in a room by the deli just so we can come downstair to eat here. Their soups are good, especially the clam chowder, and the pickles are amazing! If you like pickles, then you will die over these. Im usually not a deli type of person, but love the options here.
We ordered a club sandwich and asian chicken salad. Based on the sandwich alone, I would have given 3 stars but the salad was gross.  Maybe the burgers are the best thing to get here...

I grabbed coffee here every morning  (well except for the first morning when I waited 30 minutes in line like every other schmuck at Starbucks).  Grabbed a breakfast sandwich one morning and a late night sandwich and dessert another night.  I was never disappointed.  It's not a 5 star restaurant... it's a 24 hour deli and for what it is, it is a great addition to Luxor.

I am so glad I tried this place. I got a sandwich to take back to my room and have as a late night meal and it was deliiiicious. This 24 hour/ late night food option alone will probably be the reason I choose to stay in the Luxor again next time I'm back in Vegas. :)
I LOVE this place! When I come here for conferences I literally get the cobb salad four nights in a row. They know me now.

During our stay at the Luxor this was our favorite place to eat. The food is delicious, I recommend the California burger or the turkey burger they were both delicious! The banana creme pie is a must here, it taste so fresh I fell in love with it. For breakfast I would order the breakfast bagel sandwich with bacon, egg, and cheese, my son and I loved it we couldn't get enough of it. The food is good quality so the price is well worth the food. I also loved that this place is 24/7, so any late cravings were always satisfied. Anyone in las Vegas should give this a try.

Had the New Yorker but it was drowning in Thousand Island!! Would have been tasty otherwise. Pretzel roll would have been good too. Make sure you get the sauce on the side otherwise you're getting some sandwich on the side with your Thousand.

Staff was unfriendly.
As the only confirmed 100% Mexican on these reviews I can't vouch for the rest of the food but the chorizo breakfast wrap was legit. And the cheapest regular coffee in town $3.75.

Adequate for a quick meal fix before seeing Criss Angel.

Waffle fries were good. Hot dog was ok. Tables were a bit dirty. 

Nothing special.

THE BEST lunch I had in Las Vegas. I had the 'Boss' panini and it was fantastic. They were generous with the lunch meat, the sandwiches are huge. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. I would definitely be a regular if I lived in the area.

Great deli and breakfast spot. Tried this place after doing some Yelp research for breakfast spots while staying at Mandalay Bay at the Delano. It's about a 5 minute walk on the ground floor of the Luxor next to the Chris Angel Theater. Plenty of seating and virtually no wait for my food. The prices are about $10 less than the other sit down restaurants for a full breakfast. I liked it so much I came back for lunch. Cobb salad is tasty and a nice size.

I would try to avoid this restaurant when it comes to getting breakfast.  To say I was underwhelmed would be an understatement.

Firstly, the order was two All American Breakfasts, one for me and the girlfriend, and the total came out to over $30.  Now I know I am paying "on-strip" prices but I would at least like to see some fresh food for my dollar.  The has browns, biscuit, and sausage patty were all clearly microwaved.  The only fresh item were the eggs... hopefully.

So, at the end of the day, or the beginning of your day really, I would just keep walking around the casino floor for another 5-10 minutes before eating here.  Try to find some fresh breakfast, I still am.

One of the best options The Luxor has to offer as far as food choices go. This cafe is open 24-hrs and features breakfast items, sandwiches, salads, and soups. Portions are generous, prices are reasonable, and the food is good. If you go late-night just make sure you beat the club rush or else you'll be waiting for a while.

It's fine. California Guacamole Burger was really bland, even the meat. For $11, you'd think you'd get fries. Cashier could have at least asked if we wanted some because I would have ordered them. Oh well. Pastrami sandwich was apparently good but also bland. Maybe people with hangovers need bland food?

The Backstage Deli is one of the best places inside the Luxor to greab a bite to eat.  Positioned next to the Criss Angel theatre, the deli has all the classic items and serves 24 hours.  I had the Pastrami on Rye and it was almost as good as the more expensive version at the Carnegie Deli at Mirage.  This place delivers excellent food in short order time.

Good place to eat. They give you a lot, in a serving or their sandwiches could be shared if you bought a side too. I had the fruit plate and it was enough to share. Had two bunches of grapes green and purple, slices of watermelon, cantaloupe. Pineapple, strawberry's.  Another trip ordered a chicken salad sandwich and it had a large serving of chicken salad on it, they didn't  skimp.

This place was not good I ordered a chili dawg the chili had no beans meat only and it was dry the the hot dog was covered with bacon but could not taste the bacon in the meal there was a little amount of onions on the chili dog in total my meal was not delightful.

Great late night sandwitches, burgers and fries! I knew it would be better than regular fast food when they asked how I wanted the burger cooked. Surprisingly good considering its meant to be a "deli". Great service, open past 10pm!

Really good cheese burger & fries! The burger is a nice size and enough fries for 2 people. Waffle fries are really good too. Husband had a salad and it was huge. Prices were okay. We will eat here again.

Ordering two backstage specialty sandwiches for two left us comatose. damn good but comatose. i suggest next time sharing bc each half already weighs a pound and you don't want those extra lbs. 

entering the open corner deli inside a casino feels a lil odd especially when you see families walking towards the elevator to get to their suite or gamblers using the slots. it's a strange corner but the food was good. and well...affordable compared to all the pricey restaurants with extravagant  decor.

Not a bad choice at all for when walking too far seems like it will be the end of you.  Located on the game floor of the Luxor, this is a nice little 24/7 solution for when you are starving and need something quick. 

I had a breakfast bagel (egg, meat, cheese) for 5.99, fries (3), and an OJ for 3.99. 
Food was hot and good, nothing fancy or crazy. Just hit the spot right when close to what seems like starvation, though a lady next to me could have lived off of the 100 ketchup packets she took.

I had the corned beef burger and it was the best burger I've ever had in my life, and the best item of food I had in Vegas period! I got it because of the reviews, and this time they weren't exaggerating! It might not be others cup of tea but I appreciate the way the corned beef compliments the thick ground beef patty. To be honest I don't know if they put sauce on the burger but I didn't notice, it was just juicy and flavorful. And I wasn't even hungry when we went there, I just got it because I had a voucher I didn't want to go to waste.

Great food alternative to the McDonald's and Nathan's Hot Dogs upstairs on the atrium level in the Luxor!

My BF and I shared a chicken pesto sandwich which was really good, but could have used more pesto (I LOVE pesto!!).

The area looked clean and well kept, but we did eat our food up in our room. The employees there were all nice - from the little contact we had with them.

We wanted to go back for a late night meal (2am late), but didn't bother checking if they were open or not and ended up at Pyramid Cafe.

It's been a year since we last came here. I know the portions on the triple decker sandwiches are amazing. The last time I went I remember getting a half a pickle, pastrami on rye & a drink.

Today at 4:48PM my mother and I stopped in to share a #1. Corned beef, pastrami, Thousand Island, Provolone instead of the Swiss cheese & NO coleslaw. We had Caridad as our server, she was very soft spoken & I wasn't sure what her problem was.. when we checked out we hand her our M life cards, she asked us twice if we wanted to use them. YES, of course! *face palm* Our order came to a grand total of $12.65.

Our meal was up relatively quick, I waited a couple minutes. A heard our order number called, came up to see this sweet lady, "you must be the lucky number" she said. I laughed, "Yup, that's me", I said with a smile. I told her thank you & much appreciated. This time I noticed I had a smaller pickle but it was whole, instead of half! Nice surprise.

All in all it was a good experience, it's usually spotless in here. I LOVE this deli. It's one of the few places I'll visit to eat off the strip. We'll be back for sure!

Ok, I do not take my sandwiches lightly, maybe because I am a simple sandwich orderer and need it to be just right. I had seen this place on yelp and kind of ran into it at the Luxor, right next to the Cris Angel Theater. Saw the triple decker club and my mouth started watering! Ordered that with a side of fries and yummo! We came back here 2 more times and each time still as satisfying as the first. My husband I ate split the sandwich and fries and it was plenty of food. I kept hoping I would have room to order the yummy looking cheesecake (esp. when the kids next to us were saying how good it was) but eachtime we were too full. 

The only downer is how expensive the soda was... more expensive then the fries. We learned our lesson and kept water in my purse.

A little out of the way but soooo worth it. Quick and fresh!
Great food good price. I loved the #5 triple Decker Turkey and Bacon
Excellent late night Deli while coming out the club or a late night on the town. The food is cooked to order and always fresh. Highly recommended.

This place has the best burger I have ever had--hands down! The bun it comes on is perfect, you choose how you want your meat cooked, choice of cheese, topings, etc. Additionally, all burgers are served with a big portion of delicious hot fries (although less when you do take out for some reason). This place is open 24/7 for your convenience. My only 5/5 rating so far. Well done backstage deli, well done.

Pretty good food for a small deli style place at the Luxor. There was a long line when we showed up but their service is fast and we got our food in no time! We left the LAX club 15mins earlier than others in our group so the girls can grab a bite to eat before meeting the party bus for our next club and we made it here, ordered, got our food, and were able to meet up with the rest of the group on time. That should tell you how fast these guys work and the best part is the food actually tastes good for being a small place in a casino.

Like other reviewers, I hadn't planned to eat here.  More or less bumped into the place when looking for a quick bite inside the cavernous Luxor.  It's open 24 hrs. and is located in the Southwest corner of the casino next to the Cris Angel Showroom.  The sandwiches are huge, stacked with deli cuts of your choosing.  I believe I ordered the # 2 Triple Decker Sandwich.  It was great.  Prices are fairly reasonable too for Strip Resort food.  Several members of my party stayed at the Luxor and ended up eating here for several meals.
Best place to eat for the price while at the Luxor. Chicken salad is amazing!!!!! Onion rings are to die for!!!!!! Love the BLT!!!!! Food is fresh, fast service!!!!!

3.5 stars. Decent huge sandwiches at the usual inflated Vegas prices at this low key deli towards the back part of the Luxor casino. $10.95 got me this giant club sandwich with pastrami, turkey, cole slaw, and russian dressing all jammed between 3 slices of bread. And it was reasonably good. 

Bottom line: Not worth going out of your way for, but is a convenient and relaxed deli if you are in the Luxor/Mandalay Bay area.
yummy food. good portions. had the Philly and the club triple decker delicious. definitely come back

Tried this spot for breakfast after reading reviews. I had a breakfast sandwich. Bread was tough (seemed old), bacon was so-so. Hashbrown was not edible. My husband had the basic breakfast plate, and it also was bland. My advice, if you're looking for a quick breakfast, McDonald's would be a better choice.
Great customer service!! Amazing hours! The best thing on the menu....grilled cheese. Sourdough with cheddar you'll thank me later!

This was an exceptional find stuffed in the back corner of the Luxor.  I am all about a good sandwich, one with quality meats, great bread, great taste at a reasonable price.  Backstage created me very good sandwich.  

I had the triple stack with Turkey, Pastrami and Corned Beef on toasted Rye.  This sandwich was huge, well over a pound if I had to guess.  It was stuffed with meat, a bit too much turkey proportionate to the other two meats but otherwise very good.  My only real issue with the sandwich was the fact that the meats were cold, I expect them to be warm on a toasted sandwich.  The wife got a smaller sandwich and her meats were warm so....

Vegas casino food is generally very pricey, Backstage pricing was moderate when you consider what you get.  A one pound sandwich for $13 bucks is a reasonably good deal for a tasty meal.

I was pleasantly surprised to find a place with such cheap and delicious items! The staff was very accommodating and even when I asked for something the chef didn't even know he had or not, he went in the back and made a great effort finding it. The pesto chicken sandwich and the breakfast quesadilla were both delicious.

Luxor is a hotel I come to quite often, so naturally I was bound to eventually have to check out this place. I am personally a huge fan of sandwiches (trying to stay on the healthier side) and this place was quite the pleaser. My sandwich ran me about 10 bucks but I gotta admit it was well worth it!
Some of the best onion rings I ever had  I hate when you bite into a onion ring and you pool the whole onion out these are not like that these are perfect

Walking around Las Vegas can make you hungry. We stopped by this place because we had a great experience on a prior trip to Las Vegas. They had a great lunch deal. A half sandwich and either a small salad or a cup of soup for $7.00. They food again was excellent and the service quick and friendly. If you need a quick meal and a fair price then this is your place to eat. It is located right next the Chris Angel Theater at the Luxor Hotel Casino. 

9/13/16. In Las Vegas again and stopped by for the lunch special. Half a sandwich or soup/salad for $7.99. Still a good price for a quick meal in Las Vegas.

Surprised to see the low stars . 4 of us are here and it was good for what it is : fast food , fast . 

Turkey burger was great , the others had beef burgers , hot dog and Philly cheese steak . 

Onion ring , cole slaw fries were good too !
If I may make one suggestion :? ... The potato salad needs more flavor !

Lemon tart was a bit too sweet .

I wish I would have taken a picture of this glorious sandwich!

I had to order the triple decker after reading all the talk and yes it was worth the $13.

Three slices of bread, lettuce, tomatoes, crisp bacon, and loads of turkey! Loads. Not to mention some good sized pickles! 

At Luxor, the only places that are open 24hrs  include backstage deli, McDonald's, and the lobby Starbucks. Come here! Seriously. The quality of ingredients and the freshness is all you really want at 3am!!! :)

No matter what. Day or night. Get your breakfast, burger, sandwich, salad, wrap, and soup fix here!

Their service was a mess, but the food they served was actually pretty impressive.  Came here to grab a quick bite during the late night hours.  I had a turkey bacon sandwich, and boy was it stacked.  It measured about four inches high, and they used three slices of bread in total.  The turkey was moist, and the bacon was crisp.  The veggies were nice and fresh.  Overall a refreshing meal.  Only gripe was that the service was very slow although the place was empty.

I said my #
Got passed over a half hour for others
Can not believe disrespect on all levels
Sweet potato fries, clam chowder soup, bagel breakfast sandwich, and a chicken Parmesan wrap fries were ok and soup ok. Everything else we didn't even finish eating so disgusting.

Cashier must hate his job because he was a complete arse. 

I am guessing his role model was the "Soup Nazi".....

I didn't have the heart to remind him that there are people lined up for his minimum wage job.

Perhaps he needs to be "blind shopped" by the Luxor team.

Food was "ok"...
Egg salad was a little sweet, which was weird but still good. Sweet potato fries were amazing.

Awesom deli and fresh made desserts. Everything is made to order and delicious. If you want a full meal under $20 with a scratch made dessert then go to backstage deli. The tarts and creme pies are to die for. I ate 5 in 2 days. The banana creme pie has almost a whole banana sliced on a little tart. You have to eat here if you want a good meal at a great price!!  On top of that open 24 hours every day!!

This is one of those places I would've never tried had it not been for Yelp. A pretty nondescript little place hidden in a corner inside the Luxor you wouldn't think much of it. However, after giving it a try, I came back a second time!  Everything was made fresh to order, and the meat was being sliced right in front of you!  Definitely a nice change of pace if you are looking for something lighter to eat than say The Buffet or something in the food court.

For the price, I would not recommend this place. The soup was enough to make you nauseous, and the sheer capacity of the sandwich made the invitation of certain ingredients, a little overwhelming. While I understand the need for creativity, the sandwich was a little too overfilled with random ingredients, including French fries. Also it should be noted that the water does not taste fresh.

Surprisingly good, pastrami burger,cheese fries. .awesome definitely not what I was expecting very delicious the chorizo burrito was amazing also but the pastrami Burger definitely something worth trying
I like their food, love how they serve breakfast 24/7. We had a late night snack coming back from the club and I had a craving for a breakfast bagel. So good and fresh! Prices were very reasonable.
Chipotle chicken sandwich is the way to go! The fries are the absolute best! The line gets pretty long at prime times but it's worth the wait if you don't want food from the food court

California Burger very good. Large size patty, crispy bacon. I would definitely get again. The fries were just ok. They were shoestring and maybe because I am a potato wedge lover. The burger was $11.. And fries $2.50. Well worth the price. Quick service and they are open 24hrs. Great eating spot in the Luxor hotel. Can't wait to try other items here.

For a deli, and especially at the end of the strip, this place was pretty great all around.  clean, the chefs can cook, food was great, the entire staff was charming and professional and prompt and helpful, even when it's dead in there.  Ima be coming back here.  What a surprise

This is a nice spot to have when staying at Luxor --mostly because it's open 24/7. I ordered the Triple Decker #4 ($13.99). The sandwich is huge to say the least, which allowed me to save the other half for a late night snack. I liked the touch of coleslaw and thousand island dressing on the sandwich. My friends ordered the onion rings ($3.99), which was bomb. They give you plenty for the price and don't forget to ask for ranch to dip!

I'm gonna say 2 1/2 stars here. 

They make a pretty good sandwich and sell them for a decent price. The chicken with roasted peppers and mozzarella was perfectly acceptable for a mid-afternoon snack. I was amazed that the chicken breast they used wasn't total frozen crap. It probably WAS frozen, but it tasted better than expected. Bread was a bit tough and chewy, though. I probably should have gotten a burger or something. 

For what it's worth, my gf loved her tuna sandwich. I didn't take a bite of it since this one stuffed me (I may have also been full of booze), but take note if you're a tuna fan since apparently it's a winner. She was also super excited that the sandwiches come with a dill pickle.
Always a sure bet. Great sandwiches, no matter where I'm staying I always make it a point to come here.
I had the chicken pesto, it was delicious. I initially went for dessert but the food smelled so good. I did get dessert, the cheesecake and banana cream pie, it was bomb.

Went for a quick bite, ended up returning my food. The chicken panini wasn't warm and very bland. Low quality food. Once I asked for a refund two separate calls had to be made to management. The manager was extremely slow to show up and didn't even bother to ask what was wrong with the food, unprofessional. Wouldn't go back. There are much better places in the area.
Super dry sandwich, I asked for tots and got fries. They didn't have any ranch.. who doesn't have ranch???? I still ate the fries, they were better then the sandwich.

I don't usually stop by to buy food without first checking the reviews first  - I mean, why have good when you can have the best? Am I right? 

Anywho, I broke my rule and I found the exception!

Being famished from a booze binge and some hardcore dancing, we sniffed the air like dogs for the closest eatery and like a godsend, right off the elevator, we found backstage deli. 

I got the chicken pesto sandwich on ciabatta with chicken soup and my friend got the hamburger and fries. Both were delicious, fresh and hearty and it was more than enough to feed our mouths alone. They even include a large WHOLE juicy pickle to munch on as you devour your vittles.

Seriously, if this is what they're feeding people backstage, sneak me in!
We came here for a quick bit to eat.  We shared a turkey sandwich which was decent but the next day we ordered a tuna melt and it was gross

Definitely the BEST burger I had in Vegas, so good and juicy, and had the right amount of onion. This place is a nice quick little location to grab a quick bit to eat before a show. You also get free refills for the rest of the night, how awesome is that?? My fianc√© got the corn beef sandwich and he loved that as well! Really good food. About 35$ for dinner for two, I'll take that in Vegas!

BIGGEST WASTE of TIME!! I was craving pastrami and corned beef and all of the reviews said 'deli'. I am a local and drove all the way to Luxor only to find they have both corn beef, pastrami AND a meet carver but they were unwilling to figure out a weigh to charge me for a side of both. What?!?. How about charge me 8 bucks for a side and carve out 20 pieces. I was in the service industry forever and lazy employees who just don't care and send a customer away starving and unhappy is just absolutely unacceptable in Las Vegas. will warn everyone I know never to go here. Without customer service a restaurant has nothing.

I'm loath to tell everybody how excellent this place is, because it's the last good quick bite in Las Vegas that doesn't have a mile-long line coming out of it. This is most likely because it's hidden in a far corner of the Luxor, sort of behind the Criss Angel theatre.  Unless you're staying at the Luxor and/or went to see Criss Angel (and if you did, I'm sorry), you'd probably never find it. 

Whoever created the menu to this place is obviously a New Yorker, because they know delis here. Although eleven bucks may seem like a lot for a sandwich, you'll get what you pay for - piles and piles of fresh, mouth-melting meat on delicious toasty bread with just the right amount of tangy thousand-island dressing. It's not quite Katz's level brilliance, but I was not expecting a deli sandwich in Las Vegas to be this amazing. 

I do wish the soda fountain had a little more diversity (instead of four flavors of water that all tasted like cough syrup, a seltzer button would have been nice), and the sandwich served on "pretzel bread" was a little small, but the overwhelmingly delicious head-sized club sandwiches forgive a lot of sins.

This is the spot!!! A must have while in Vegas! Specially if you're not into buffets. The only thing I regret is not knowing about it sooner. The breakfast club sandwich hits the spot!! Their pastries are pretty good as well.

Ate here late Saturday night as this is the only place open. Long line as expected. Cooks seem to be busting their butts making orders but not "in order" if that makes sense. 

We ordered a Reuben with waffle fries and were given #4, they were still calling #'s in the 90's. They got to #99 then #'s 1, 2 and 3. Then #15, 13, 9, 7. I can see if they had like hotdogs, pastries or something easy to make but they were getting triple decker pastrami's and sh*t. WTF!! Our order should've come first!

We waited like 15-20 minutes after they called #3 before they finally called our #4. Bullsh*t! As for the food it was just alright.

This place was a great find hidden in the back of the casino.  I was tired to trying to find food amongst the sea of overpriced theme restaurants, and then I ran across Backstage Deli.  They have a wide variety on the menu and their sandwiches are huge.  The price was reasonable as well.  It is cafeteria style a bit where you pick your stuff, order, pay and they call you to pick it up.  I would definitely come back here for a good alternative to a pricy buffet any day.

Rude as hell service. Ordered a simple sandwich and they went a dozen numbers past me. Went up to inquire about my order and was met with an extremely rude older woman who told me that I didn't matter and to go sit down... what?! Another member of my group was completely forgotten and again no apology, just told to sit down.

After hearing about how not good the buffet at the Luxor was, we decided to have dinner here at the BD. A little place tucked in the back, we checked out the prices which are very reasonable (relatively) and ordered. I got the chicken caesar salad sandwich and a drink which ran me about $15. After the six of us ordered, we grabbed a table, and waited a few minutes, a testament that they're made fresh. Mine came out first and I waited 'til everyone got there's. I was pleasantly surprised that the chicken was hot, as I was expecting a cold sandwich all around. Anyways, it was BOMB, and I would totez go again

Hence the name its a Deli so if you order anything else honestly your not giving yourself justice. Their sandwiches are awesome and packed in. The pastrami with corn beef is my favorite. If you love to bet on sports well its only 20 ft away from the sports book. You can catch whatever game you have money on while you enjoy these wonderful sandwiches. I highly recommend it... I feel sorry for the guy who went here for a cajun Dog, Really dude! As for the service if you want quick service go to a fast food joint.

I was staying at Mandalay bay and after a long night of vegas debauchery I needed some grub. I guess I wondered off like a drunken zombie around 3 am. Not having eaten for about ten hours and having consumed enough alcohol to kill a small horse I would have eaten anything. Well unfortunately for me there are no options for late night grub at Mandalay Bay outside of room service.

So I did the drunk zombie shuffle over to luxor and find a McDonald's.  There are about 70 other drunk idiots there in front of me so I continued my quest. I ended up downstairs and hapened upon this place. 

You order your food quick service style and they shout your number when its ready. Lady working the counter was pretty rude. I had asked for a water cup which I saw they had them but she told me you have to buy bottled water. Im a cheap ass especially when drunk. Really you want me to pay several dollars for a miniscule amount of the thing most prevalent on this planet. To add insult to injury as I was leaving I saw a group of people drinking water out of there damn water cups.

The food I had was ok nothing I would ever crave or seek out. I had there breakfast sandwich no better than McDonald's but quite a bit more expensive.  I also had there California burger the following night and a few bites of a turkey wrap. The burger was greasy the guacamole horible I scraped it off, But if its 3am your drunk enough and dont want to wait in a huge line at McDonald's not a bad option of the two available.

Every time I come to Vegas and stay at luxor I know I'm gonna eat at the backstage deli at least once a day. Everything they do is great, from the simple desserts and coffee to the Chicago dog and the triple deckers. The great thing is open 24/7. And they have a huge chicken Caesar salad and very delicious. Another cool option is you can tell them you want your food to go and they'll bag it up so you can take it to your room.

Line is shorter here than the other Luxor restaurants, mainly due to its location ( back corner)- however the wait for your food is still semi long. We had a late breakfast here, but the food was great. I ordered the breakfast club. Portions are decent and filling. Recommend for an easy- filling tasty breakfast. Would try again. They also have a small pasty section with delicious looking cakes.

While Las Vegas definitely has LOTS of food, I haven't found many meals particularly memorable. But after over 12 years of visiting the same Mandalay properties, for pretty much the same conferences, you get to know your reliable, flavor-filled, consistent favorites, and Backstage is one of them.

Simple menu, but each item is high quality and the little details makes it into your go-to book, like house-made salsas that actually taste flavorful and not from a food service merchant. (lots of this city is sourced from the same suppliers)

Back in the corner or Luxor, to the side of the magic theatre, you're away from the smokers, and out of earshot of the many nightclub venues towards the front. Wifi is strong here, and the staff courteous and quick, and very personable.

I prefer this stop over the Luxor's coffee shop (the other 24x7 choice here), which by comparison is pretty generic. Opposite corner from the ubiquitous Starbucks. Top of the escalator (main floor level), if you're coming in from self park.

Always been able to refill my coffee as the day wears on, and they can customize pretty much everything to your dietary needs. Like some of the local places that are way off Strip, Broadway is kinda like stopping home in an otherwise boisterous city.


I

Been here a couple times for lunch & dinner. The burger, sandwiches, hot dog are consistently good. 
Located by the Cris Angel box office.

Great place if you are hungry and want something quick to eat there or take up to your room. I have tried the #11 Pollo Panini, #3 Turkey Bacon Triple Decker, Chocolate Mousse, & Fruit Tart. Everything was delicious and it is definitely a place worth coming back to.
I had chili and it seemed to be nothing more than left over taco meat. No beans! My friend had noodle soup which was served luke warm. We were both greatly disappointed.

This place ah-maze-ing! Have been here twice and the food has been consistently delicious, well and freshly made.  Had the burger with cheese, it was well done, tasty, and juicy (mouth waters just thinking about it...) Definitely check this place out inside the Luxor. I believe it is open 24hours so there's no reason to miss this. It IS at the end of the strip which is too bad for the Deli, but I'm sure those who discover this place will enjoy it.

After my friend and I had finished watching a show, we were hungry. We decided to head back to Luxor and figure out where to grab a quick bite to eat. We found Backstage Deli and decided to drop by before heading back to the hotel.

The place was busy at 10 pm, likely because we were the after-the-show crowd. I decided to reserve a booth by putting my sweater on one of the benches. We then went to place our orders.

There were a couple of times during my trip where I either did not take photos of my food, or did and they came out blurry. The latter happened here. I ordered a Reuben sandwich with potato salad as a side. I also got a drink.

Both my pics of the sandwich and salad were blurry. I blame the dark lighting in the eatery and my phone. Luckily, I was able to post my potato salad photo, as I could salvage it by sharpening it up. My Reuben photo was a lost cause. It was a blob of dark fuzziness. Instead, I will describe how yummy it was.

My Reuben sandwich consisted of corned beef, sauerkraut, and Swiss cheese, on toasted rye bread with a yummy sauce. You can make it a combo by adding a side and a small drink, so I got potato salad and a fountain drink.

My Reuben sandwich was perfect. Normally, the sauerkraut makes the bread soggy. However, the rye was toasted perfectly that I didn't get any sogginess and the bread didn't take off the roof of my mouth. The corned beef was tender and flavourful. It was a great sandwich that hit the spot.

I loved the potato salad. It was chunky and yummy. I liked that I could avoid getting fries.

If you want cheap, good eats at any time of the day, come here.

(173)
This place should drop the word deli from it's name, pathetic options served on plastic dishes with plastic silver ware. Keep on walking, do not eat here.

This is a good place to go for a quick bite, but there was confusion surrounding our trip.  Only because of the reviews here we knew to look near the Criss Angel theater.  My husband and I first tried to get dinner there on Monday but it was closed, despite the sign there that said it was open for breakfast, lunch and dinner hours (the Vegas 2 Go magazine says hours are from 7 am to 2 pm Sun - Thurs, 7 am to 11 pm Fri - Sat).  We went back for lunch today.  The cashier lady had trouble ringing us up, and after asking for help rang us up for our orders, a chicken sandwich for my husband and a phillly cheesesteak for me.  They got both our orders completely wrong - I think the cashier rang us up incorrectly although our receipt reflected the correct orders.  After we told them, they promptly got us the sandwiches we ordered.  My sandwich tasted good but the meat was all pushed to the middle, leaving my ends with no filling and just bread.  Despite all of this, I'd still recommend it if you want something quick and relatively cheap while at the Luxor, but just hope they don't get your orders mixed up.
Visited again during our annual LV christmas gathering. This place is awesome. Fries are otherworldly. Love their pastramis & reubens.

Had late night munchies. We split roast beef melt (the special of the night), onion rings, and cinnamon roll. I'd say onion rings (with their house made ranch!!) and cinnamon roll were both 10/10. The melt is give 7/10, but that might just be because I'm not a huge Swiss cheese fan.

Open 24/7. Tucked away in a back corner of the Luxor, next to Criss Angel's Believe theater. I got a Pesto Chicken sandwich and it was quite good and served quickly. A bit pricy though. Probably one of the better options around the Luxor for reasonably priced food open late.

wuuuttt tha F...the chicken noodle sooup here is some of the most amazing chx noodle soup i've ever had. shit, i ate it for dinner 3 nites in a row! cuz soup is good for the alcoholic soul ;) the sandwiches are awesome too! the quality and amount of meat, bread (foccacia), etc is pretty top notch considering it's a deli in *luxor*. i think this is one of the few places in vegas u can grab a roughly nutritious meal for under $20 and in less than a half hour! and to keep it that way, im not gonna tell u where it is in luxor. ha!

Hilariously in the sense that this is exactly what Vegas food consisted of in the late 80's and early 90's. Typical reheated, cafeteria-influenced eggs/sausage/bacon and standard sandwiches. The breakfast is notably poor, as the eggs will guaranteed be overcooked, the sausage rubbery and the biscuits cold. The sandwiches are decent, but very oily and the bread is soggy. I guess an advantage is the fact that it's open 24 hours, but why would you want bad food at all hours in this day and age? Go somewhere else unless you really are obligated to eat in this poorly-located, poorly-staffed countertop deli.

If you can make it there you can not make it anywhere else... New york style deli vered ! Chicken salad never white knuckled my palate with so much flavor... Open 24 hours is not clich√© at luxor hotel las vegas.

This deli was phenomenal.  We ate here late at night (they are open 24 hours) and opted for #1 which was a pastrami and corned beef sandwich.  The food came out quick and it was excellent.  I would highly recommend this place for a late night deli sandwich.

Triple decker club was perfect... Tons of bacon and turkey on sourdough.  Came with a couple of pickle slices. Delicious. I had their onion rings and they too were hot and fresh. They lose a star for price... And I'm talking right at the 5 dollar bottle of water.  Oh well,  think of it as a subsidy for great food in a tourist trap and it's all good. I'd eat here again.
Open 24 hours.  Around $10 for a sandwich, but they are good size.  Food is hot and fresh.   Conveniently located off of elevator 2 to stop and bring a sandwich up to your room before bed.

Really surprising that this place was so good! I came here for breakfast right before I caught my plane and I ordered the skirt steak with fried eggs on baguette. While it could have used some sauce, the meat was SO tender and I was surprised that we got such a good steak for only $9.99! There was a lot of meat, lots of egg, and just all around goodness. I had been going to the breakfast buffet at the Luxor but this place really surprised me because it's one of the least aesthetically appealing place that I've seen at the Luxor (besides the food court, perhaps).

This was a great stop before heading to the room on our first night here ... after many drinks!

Really good tasty balanced patty melt.  Fries were good.  Friends sandwich was good.  The characters showing up on the late night ... priceless.

On the last day of our Vegas trip, my husband and I went searching for a quick bit to eat before heading back home. While we were paying for our order I noticed that there were a pretty good number of people waiting for their orders by the pick up area. I assumed it just meant that the restaurant was really busy because the food was good. Not the case. They just had really, really slow service. I went to the soda fountain to fill up my drink cup. The ice dispenser wasn't working. Some people at a table nearby saw me fumbling with the drink machine and pointed at a plastic container. I removed the cover and found ice and an ice spoon. Ew. I don't generally consider myself a germophobe, but that was gross. The container seemed to be newly filled so I decided to throw sanitation to the wind and add a few cubes to my drink - only because I abhor warm soda. By the time they finally called out our number, I was starving. I looked down at my plate and all I could do was feel disappointment. I ordered the corned beef hash with over-medium eggs. The eggs were ok. The corned beef has looked and tasted like it was straight out of a can. I was so hungry that I ate everything any way, but I think I would have been better off grabbing something from McDonald's instead. The only reason I'm adding an extra star is because they're open 24 hours a day. (Side note if you're looking for late night dining options: the McDonald's in the Luxor food court is open 24/7 too.)

I discovered this place out of convenience, but soon found ourselves walking all the way from the convention at Mandalay Bay just to eat here, and take food back for the others.  So far tried the oriental chicken salad (we ordered at least 5 during our trip) the lox platter(ordered 3) the turkey decker(x2) Turkey on focaccia(x2)  grilled veggie panini (they made it on the focaccia for me) and the chicken sandwich with mozzarella. We customized it a bit though.  No mayo, sauce on the side... 
I'm just not a burger and hot dog kinda girl, But they have those too if you like that kinda stuff.
The turkey club is delicious. The waffle fries are tasty but greasy. Expensive for a sandwich but huge portion.

Yummy! We stopped in for a drunken bite to eat at the Luxor on our way back to Mandalay Bay. The sandwiches were HUGE and I was impressed by the freshness of bread and meats. They are extremely generous with their servings of meat, if you look at the picture I took.. I couldn't even fit my mouth around it! It was delicious! I would definitely go back.

What the heck are the people who rave about this place talking about??!!

Not only are the sandwiches about $10 but we definitely were disappointed by the quality of the food. I got some special they had going that came with the chicken salad pita sandwich and fries. It was about $12....the chicken salad was more of mayo salad with some chicken in it. The only good thing were the fries but come on fries are kind of hard to mess up!
My friend got a chicken sandwich and she was disappointed with how bland it was. Nothing was used to season it...she had to use lots of condiments to make the thing edible.
Oh and they ordered one soda since a small drink at the place is $3.99!!! Yes, really!! This place is just a rip off...definitely not worth for what they are charging.
If you want to find a good sandwich...go to Planet Hollywood's food court that's in that shopping center and stop at the Earl of Sandwich. Now that's a great sandwich place!

The place was a mess when we came for a bite to eat after checking at night.  The staff was very friendly, but every other table was trashed and dirty.  
My friend and I shared a Patty Melt and Oriental Chicken Salad for around $20 total.  The Patty Melt was super hot and pretty good, it just lacked some salt and pepper.  On the other hand, the salad was a letdown.  The chicken was flavorless and dry, plus the prepackaged dressing did not taste good at all.

Awesome food! Fresh and hot, burgers are huge and the fries are also delish! The only down fall is that their stuck in the back and I didn't know they were their until my last day at the Luxor. I would of took more visits at the deli! Did I mention the burgers are HUGE!!

We were exhausted after a ridiculously long day and decided to just get burgers and sandwiches from the deli. Great call! Reasonably priced good food. My husband had the pastrami burger which he said was better then the burger he had earlier in the day at an actual burger restaurant. I had a tuna salad sandwich and my daughter had a hot dog. 

Service was friendly and quick and portions were satisfying. Glad we checked it out - it's not someplace we would have ever chosen had it not been such a long day and in our hotel.

this place was seriously right outside of our elevator so we walked passed it 10 times a day. for me, the best thing about this place is the convenience (close to our room in Luxor and also opened ALL the time) 

price was reasonable considering it Vegas and inside the hotel/casino. 

Food was typical... but I like the variaty of choices.

I've had the potatoe pancakes (REALLY good like a soft hashbrown), Sweet potatoe fries (really good and cheap too), chicken noodle soup (to recover... you know) but their soup menu is writen on a board that's not on the menu, and then I had the chicken salad sandwich which was kinda dry but it was okay. My friend had a chicken salad and it was HUGE!!! plenty of avocadoes and other goodies in the salad and so big that the entire table couldn't finish it. 

Pretty fast service deli/diner... no waiter so you gotta get your own food and then put the tray away afterwards. 

Definitely recommend this place if your staying at Luxor... but if not... it's not worth the trip... they're opened REALLYY late so maybe you'll want to try it if eveything else is closed. Oh Cris Angel is right next to this so maybe if you decide to come watch that and then stop by here for a late snack. 

food quality is really not great but very convenient

more like 3.5/5 stars

i got the sweet potatoes, onion rings and the Grilled Vegetable Panini.

prices are similar to other deli places in vegas.  the sandwich is about 9 bucks or so.  

the sweet potatoes and onion rings were super good.  but the vegetable panini was just "ok".... i'm definitely more of a carnivore, so i don't know what i was thinking when i ordered the veggy panini... i blame my drunk self...  T_T 

very convenient because its located at the bottom of elevator 2.

the cook was funny and joked around with me.

the time to get the food took about like 7-10 minutes....

Decent food freshly made.  Got the turkey blt on wheat toasted.  I like my bacon done but it was too crunchy.
